TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jequetepeque[COLOR_REVERT] (the Moche replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warrior[COLOR_REVERT]) receives bonuses to attack and defense when fighting in hills.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]jequetepeque[COLOR_REVERT] (équivalent moche du [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]guerrier[COLOR_REVERT]) reçoit un bonus d'attaque et de défense au cours des combats dans des collines.
TEXT.German: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jequetepeque[COLOR_REVERT] (the Moche replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warrior[COLOR_REVERT]) receives bonuses to attack and defense when fighting in hills.
TEXT.Italian: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jequetepeque[COLOR_REVERT] (the Moche replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warrior[COLOR_REVERT]) receives bonuses to attack and defense when fighting in hills.
TEXT.Spanish: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jequetepeque[COLOR_REVERT] (the Moche replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warrior[COLOR_REVERT]) receives bonuses to attack and defense when fighting in hills.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Moche settlements in the Jequetepeque Valley were characterized by fortifications and defensive works. While there is no evidence of a foreign invasion, as many scholars have suggested in the past (i.e. a Huari invasion), there is some evidence of social unrest, possibly the result of climatic changes as factions fought for control over scarce resources.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Moche settlements in the Jequetepeque Valley were characterized by fortifications and defensive works. While there is no evidence of a foreign invasion, as many scholars have suggested in the past (i.e. a Huari invasion), there is some evidence of social unrest, possibly the result of climatic changes as factions fought for control over scarce resources.
